answerText: "Futility"[10] This other poem by the author of "Futility" describes how in boys' eyes "Shall shine the holy glimmers of goodbyes" and begins, "What passing-bells for these who die as cattle?"
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 1 | 9 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This poem asks, "Are limbs, so dear-achieved, are sides, Full-nerved  still warm  too hard to stir?" after the speaker commands, "Move him into the sun  Gently its touch awoke him once." For 10 points each: [10] Name this poem which ends with the question, "O what made fatuous sunbeams toil To break earth's sleep at all?"
